result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle M Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: from Atty Eagon re: Notice of Completion of Representation
Appointed Attorney Tristan Eagon

11:32am/12:09pm.  Cases called: 17CT106, 14CF263, 14CF3. Defendant Kyle M Berg in court, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to 17CT106.  Court will accept plea and enter JOC.  Court imposes a fine of $443.00 due 60 days or pay plan. Submit DNA sample. Court imposes on 14CF3: ct 1: 3 years initial & 2 years ES; Ct 2: 3 years initial & 2 years ES concurrent, ct 3: 9 months concurrent.  876 days jail credit.     Court imposes on 14CF263: 2 years initial & 3 years ES consecutive to 14CF3.  211 days jail credit.  Sentence forthwith.
Appointed Attorney Tristan Eagon
Second Amended filed by agent Feldner

Defendant Kyle M Berg in court, in custody with attorney Tristan F Eagon.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 17CT106, 14CF03 and 14CF263.  Atty Eagon has been trying to get a date from Br. 1 JA for sentencing after rev. hearing. Has gotten no response. Will walk over to Br. 1 JA after court today to get a date for both cases.
